title: Expanding the postsecondary educational institutions eligible to participate in the Kansas promise scholarship program and increasing the maximum annual appropriation limit.

other_titles.title: AN ACT concerning education; relating to the Kansas promise scholarship program; expanding the postsecondary educational institutions eligible to participate in such program; increasing the maximum appropriation for such program; amending K.S.A. 2024 Supp. 74-32,271, 74-32,274 and 74-32,274, as amended by section 2 of this act, and repealing the existing sections.

Referred to Committee on Financial Institutions and Insurance
Committee Report recommending bill be passed by Committee on Financial Institutions and Insurance

Committee of the Whole - Be passed

Received and Introduced
Referred to Committee on Insurance
Hearing: Wednesday, February 26, 2025, 3:30 PM Room 218-N
Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Insurance

Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
Emergency Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 106 Nay: 17
Nonconcurred with amendments; Conference Committee requested; appointed
Motion to accede adopted;  Representative Sutton,  Representative Bergkamp and  Representative Neighbor appointed as  conferees
Senator Erickson,  Senator Thomas, and  Senator Sykes are appointed to replace  Senator Dietrich,  Senator Fagg, and  Senator Francisco on the Conference Committee

Representative Estes,  Representative McNorton, and  Representative Stogsdill are appointed to replace  Representative Sutton,  Representative Bergkamp, and  Representative Neighbor on the Conference Committee
Conference committee report now available
Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Representative Estes,  Representative McNorton and  Representative Stogsdill appointed as second conferees
Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Senator Erickson,  Senator Thomas and  Senator Sykes appointed as second conferees
Conference committee report now available
Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 76 Nay: 48
Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 40 Nay: 0
Enrolled and presented to Governor on Friday, April 18, 2025
Vetoed by Governor; Returned to Senate on Friday, April 25, 2025
The Legislature having adjourned sine die on April 11, 2025, there was no opportunity to reconsider and the veto is sustained.
